callback.translation[0].definitions[0].d: an occasion when someone is asked to come back, especially for another job interview
callback.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Managers often request callbacks in order to find out more about the candidate or to introduce him or her to other members of a department.
callback.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a telephone call that you make back to someone who called you earlier
callback.translation[0].definitions[1].e: More than half of the problems are resolved promptly by the agency and do not require callbacks to customers.
callback.translation[0].definitions[2].d: an occasion when a customer takes goods back to a store, or complains about goods or services, because there is something wrong
callback.translation[0].definitions[2].e: We used to get two or three callbacks a month for unlevel cabinets, and now we don’t get any.
callback.translation[0].definitions[3].d: an occasion when someone has to go back in to work in order to deal with a serious situation there
callback.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Employees receive double the normal rate of pay for a callback on the employee’s regular day of rest.
